name: Calabar Museum
description: A historical museum showcasing colonial artifacts and the slave trade history of Calabar.

name: Drill Monkey Sanctuary
description: A conservation center for endangered Drill monkeys with guided educational tours.

name: Tinapa Resort
description: An expansive resort offering leisure, retail, and business facilities along the Calabar River.

name: Slave History Museum
description: A museum chronicling the harrowing history of the transatlantic slave trade in Calabar.

name: Kwa Falls
description: A scenic waterfall in a tropical rainforest, perfect for picnics and nature walks.

name: Marina Resort
description: A riverfront resort with boat rides, eateries, and recreational activities for families.

name: Calabar Botanical Garden
description: A serene garden with diverse plant species and shaded walkways for nature lovers.

name: Obudu Mountain Resort
description: A mountain-top resort with breathtaking views, cable cars, and cool climate.

name: Millennium Park
description: An urban park with walking paths, playgrounds, and open space for community events.

name: Calabar Carnival Arena
description: The main venue for the annual Calabar Carnival, Africa's biggest street party.
